title: DeepLabCut installed without GUI
body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Bug description

I installed DeepLabCut according to the recommended steps (see "Steps to Reproduce"), but it appears to have installed without GUI support. I get the following errors when I import DLC in an ipython session and attempt to label frames:
Commands:
```
ipython  

import deeplabcut  
```

Error:
```
2022-02-03 12:32:05.248671: W tensorflow/stream_executor/platform/default/dso_loader.cc:64] Could not load dynamic library 'libcudart.so.11.0'; dlerror: libcudart.so.11.0: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
2022-02-03 12:32:05.248699: I tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cudart_stub.cc:29] Ignore above cudart dlerror if you do not have a GPU set up on your machine.
DLC loaded in light mode; you cannot use any GUI (labeling, relabeling and standalone GUI)
/home/blackmonlab/anaconda3/envs/DEEPLABCUT/lib/python3.8/site-packages/statsmodels/compat/pandas.py:65: FutureWarning: pandas.Int64Index is deprecated and will be removed from pandas in a future version. Use pandas.Index with the appropriate dtype instead.
  from pandas import Int64Index as NumericIndex
```

Commands:
```
path_config = '/home/blackmonlab/SurfaceAnnotated-annabel-2022-01-24/config.yaml'  

deeplabcut.label_frames(path_config)
```

Error:
```
AttributeError                            Traceback (most recent call last)
Input In [3], in 
----> 1 deeplabcut.label_frames(path_config)

AttributeError: module 'deeplabcut' has no attribute 'label_frames'
```

### Operating System

operating system
Distributor ID: Ubuntu
Description: Ubuntu 18.04.6 LTS
Release: 18.04
Codename: bionic
270.2 GB RAM


### DeepLabCut version

dlc version
2.2.0.6

### DeepLabCut mode

single animal

### Device type

gpu
01:00.0 VGA compatible controller: NVIDIA Corporation Device 1e04 (rev a1)

### Steps To Reproduce

```
git clone https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut.git

cd /home/blackmonlab/DeepLabCut/conda-environments

conda env create -f DEEPLABCUT.yaml

conda activate DEEPLABCUT

ipython

import deeplabcut

deeplabcut.create_new_project('SurfaceAnnotated','annabel',['/home/blackmonlab/Documents/Annabel/NeuralNetworkProject/DLCSurfaceAnnotated/videos/Surface 1 41486.mp4','/home/blackmonlab/Documents/Annabel/NeuralNetworkProject/DLCSurfaceAnnotated/videos/Surface 2 45209.mp4','/home/blackmonlab/Documents/Annabel/NeuralNetworkProject/DLCSurfaceAnnotated/videos/Surface 3 03428.mp4'])
```

Add body parts to config.yaml

### Relevant log output

_No response_

### Anything else?

I attempted to downgrade tensorflow from 2.8.0 to 2.5.0, but got the following error when I did so (and the original problem was not solved by the downgrade):
```
ERROR: pip's dependency resolver does not currently take into account all the packages that are installed. This behaviour is the source of the following dependency conflicts.
black 22.1.0 requires typing-extensions>=3.10.0.0; python_version < "3.10", but you have typing-extensions 3.7.4.3 which is incompatible.

```

### Code of Conduct

- [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md)
